segment.source: Device Portal for Desktop
segment.target: Device Portal for Desktop

segment.source: Learn how the Windows Device Portal opens up diagnostics and automation on your Windows desktop.
segment.target: Learn how the Windows Device Portal opens up diagnostics and automation on your Windows desktop.

segment.source: Device Portal for Desktop
segment.target: Device Portal for Desktop

segment.source: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1607, additional developer features are available for desktop.
segment.target: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1607, additional developer features are available for desktop.

segment.source: These features are available only when Developer Mode is enabled.
segment.target: These features are available only when Developer Mode is enabled.

segment.source: For information about how to enable Developer Mode, see Enable your device for development.
segment.target: For information about how to enable Developer Mode, see Enable your device for development.

segment.source: Device Portal lets you view diagnostic information and interact with your desktop over HTTP from your browser.
segment.target: Device Portal lets you view diagnostic information and interact with your desktop over HTTP from your browser.

segment.source: You can use Device Portal to do the following:
segment.target: You can use Device Portal to do the following:

segment.source: See and manipulate a list of running processes
segment.target: See and manipulate a list of running processes

segment.source: Install, delete, launch, and terminate apps
segment.target: Install, delete, launch, and terminate apps

segment.source: Change Wi-Fi profiles, view signal strength, and see ipconfig
segment.target: Change Wi-Fi profiles, view signal strength, and see ipconfig

segment.source: View live graphs of CPU, memory, I/O, network, and GPU usage
segment.target: View live graphs of CPU, memory, I/O, network, and GPU usage

segment.source: Collect process dumps
segment.target: Collect process dumps

segment.source: Collect ETW traces
segment.target: Collect ETW traces

segment.source: Manipulate the isolated storage of sideloaded apps
segment.target: Manipulate the isolated storage of sideloaded apps

segment.source: Set up device portal on Windows Desktop
segment.target: Set up device portal on Windows Desktop

segment.source: Turn on device portal
segment.target: Turn on device portal

segment.source: In the Developer Settings menu, with Developer Mode enabled, you can enable Device Portal.
segment.target: In the Developer Settings menu, with Developer Mode enabled, you can enable Device Portal.

segment.source: When you enable Device Portal, you must also create a username and password for Device Portal.
segment.target: When you enable Device Portal, you must also create a username and password for Device Portal.

segment.source: Do not use your Microsoft account or other Windows credentials.
segment.target: Do not use your Microsoft account or other Windows credentials.

segment.source: After Device Portal is enabled, you will see links to it at the bottom of the Settings section.
segment.target: After Device Portal is enabled, you will see links to it at the bottom of the Settings section.

segment.source: Take note of the port number applied to the end of the URL: this port number is randomly generated when Device Portal is enabled, but should remain consistent between reboots of the desktop.
segment.target: Take note of the port number applied to the end of the URL: this port number is randomly generated when Device Portal is enabled, but should remain consistent between reboots of the desktop.

segment.source: If you'd like to set the port numbers manually so they remain permanent, see Setting port numbers.
segment.target: If you'd like to set the port numbers manually so they remain permanent, see Setting port numbers.

segment.source: You can choose from two ways to connect to Device Portal: local host and over the local network (including VPN).
segment.target: You can choose from two ways to connect to Device Portal: local host and over the local network (including VPN).

segment.source: To connect to Device Portal
segment.target: To connect to Device Portal

segment.source: In your browser, enter the address shown here for the connection type you're using.
segment.target: In your browser, enter the address shown here for the connection type you're using.

segment.source: Localhost: or
segment.target: Localhost: or

segment.source: Use this address to view Device Portal locally.
segment.target: Use this address to view Device Portal locally.

segment.source: Local Network:
segment.target: Local Network:

segment.source: Use this address to connect over a local network.
segment.target: Use this address to connect over a local network.

segment.source: HTTPS is required for authentication and secure communication.
segment.target: HTTPS is required for authentication and secure communication.

segment.source: If you are using Device Portal in a protected environment, like a test lab, where you trust everyone on your local network, have no personal information on the device, and have unique requirements, you can disable authentication.
segment.target: If you are using Device Portal in a protected environment, like a test lab, where you trust everyone on your local network, have no personal information on the device, and have unique requirements, you can disable authentication.

segment.source: This enables unencrypted communication, and allows anyone with the IP address of your computer to control it.
segment.target: This enables unencrypted communication, and allows anyone with the IP address of your computer to control it.

segment.source: Device Portal pages
segment.target: Device Portal pages

segment.source: Device Portal on desktop provides the standard set of pages.
segment.target: Device Portal on desktop provides the standard set of pages.

segment.source: For detailed descriptions, see Windows Device Portal overview.
segment.target: For detailed descriptions, see Windows Device Portal overview.

segment.source: App File Explorer

segment.source: Setting port numbers
segment.target: Setting port numbers

segment.source: If you would like to select port numbers for Device Portal (such as 80 and 443), you can set the following regkeys:
segment.target: If you would like to select port numbers for Device Portal (such as 80 and 443), you can set the following regkeys:

segment.source: Under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\WebManagement\Service
segment.target: Under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\WebManagement\Service

segment.source: UseDynamicPorts: A required DWORD.
segment.target: UseDynamicPorts: A required DWORD.

segment.source: Set this to 0 in order to retain the port numbers you've chosen.
segment.target: Set this to 0 in order to retain the port numbers you've chosen.

segment.source: HttpPort: A required DWORD.
segment.target: HttpPort: A required DWORD.

segment.source: Contains the port number that Device Portal will listen for HTTP connections on.
segment.target: Contains the port number that Device Portal will listen for HTTP connections on.

segment.source: HttpsPort: A required DWORD.
segment.target: HttpsPort: A required DWORD.

segment.source: Contains the port number that Device Portal will listen for HTTPS connections on.
segment.target: Contains the port number that Device Portal will listen for HTTPS connections on.

segment.source: Failure to install Developer Mode package
segment.target: Failure to install Developer Mode package

segment.source: Sometimes, due to network or compatibility issues, Developer Mode won't install correctly.
segment.target: Sometimes, due to network or compatibility issues, Developer Mode won't install correctly.

segment.source: The Developer Mode package is required for remote deployment -- Device Portal and SSH -- but not for local development.
segment.target: The Developer Mode package is required for remote deployment -- Device Portal and SSH -- but not for local development.

segment.source: Failed to locate the package
segment.target: Failed to locate the package

segment.source: "Developer Mode package couldn’t be located in Windows Update.
segment.target: "Developer Mode package couldn’t be located in Windows Update.

segment.source: Error Code 0x001234 Learn more"
segment.target: Error Code 0x001234 Learn more"

segment.source: This error may occur due to a network connectivity problem, Enterprise settings, or the package may be missing.
segment.target: This error may occur due to a network connectivity problem, Enterprise settings, or the package may be missing.

segment.source: To fix this issue:
segment.target: To fix this issue:

segment.source: Ensure your computer is connected to the Internet.
segment.target: Ensure your computer is connected to the Internet.

segment.source: If you are on a domain-joined computer, speak to your network administrator.
segment.target: If you are on a domain-joined computer, speak to your network administrator.

segment.source: Check for Windows updates in the Settings > Updates and Security > Windows Updates.
segment.target: Check for Windows updates in the Settings > Updates and Security > Windows Updates.

segment.source: Verify that the Windows Developer Mode package is present in Settings > System > Apps & Features > Manage optional features > Add a feature.
segment.target: Verify that the Windows Developer Mode package is present in Settings > System > Apps & Features > Manage optional features > Add a feature.

segment.source: If it is missing, Windows cannot find the correct package for your computer.
segment.target: If it is missing, Windows cannot find the correct package for your computer.

segment.source: After doing any of the above steps, disable and then re-enable Developer Mode to verify the fix.
segment.target: After doing any of the above steps, disable and then re-enable Developer Mode to verify the fix.

segment.source: Failed to install the package
segment.target: Failed to install the package

segment.source: "Developer Mode package failed to install.
segment.target: "Developer Mode package failed to install.

segment.source: Error code 0x001234 Learn more"
segment.target: Error code 0x001234 Learn more"

segment.source: This error may occur due to incompatibilities between your build of Windows and the Developer Mode package.
segment.target: This error may occur due to incompatibilities between your build of Windows and the Developer Mode package.

segment.source: To fix this issue:
segment.target: To fix this issue:

segment.source: Check for Windows updates in the Settings > Updates and Security > Windows Updates.
segment.target: Check for Windows updates in the Settings > Updates and Security > Windows Updates.

segment.source: Reboot your computer to ensure all updates are applied.
segment.target: Reboot your computer to ensure all updates are applied.
